description: Creates a subnet in the specified VPC. For an IPv4 only subnet, specify an IPv4 CIDR block. If the VPC has an IPv6 CIDR block, you can create an IPv6 only subnet or a dual stack subnet instead. For an IPv6 only subnet, specify an IPv6 CIDR block. For a dual stack subnet, specify both an IPv4 CIDR block and an IPv6 CIDR block. A subnet CIDR block must not overlap the CIDR block of an existing subnet in the VPC. After you create a subnet, you can't change its CIDR block. The allowed size for an IPv4 subnet is between a /28 netmask (16 IP addresses) and a /16 netmask (65,536 IP addresses). Amazon Web Services reserves both the first four and the last IPv4 address in each subnet's CIDR block. They're not available for your use. If you've associated an IPv6 CIDR block with your VPC, you can associate an IPv6 CIDR block with a subnet when you create it. If you add more than one subnet to a VPC, they're set up in a star topology with a logical router in the middle. When you stop an instance in a subnet, it retains its private IPv4 address. It's therefore possible to have a subnet with no running instances (they're all stopped), but no remaining IP addresses available. For more information, see Subnets in the Amazon VPC User Guide.

parameters.name: TagSpecifications
parameters.description: The tags to assign to the subnet. (dict) --- The tags to apply to a resource when the resource is being created. When you specify a tag, you must specify the resource type to tag, otherwise the request will fail. ResourceType (string) --- The type of resource to tag on creation. Tags (list) --- The tags to apply to the resource. (dict) --- Describes a tag. Key (string) --- The key of the tag. Constraints: Tag keys are case-sensitive and accept a maximum of 127 Unicode characters. May not begin with aws:. Value (string) --- The value of the tag. Constraints: Tag values are case-sensitive and accept a maximum of 256 Unicode characters.

nested_params.name: ResourceType
nested_params.description: The type of resource to tag on creation.

nested_params.name: Tags
nested_params.description: The tags to apply to the resource.

nested_params.name: Key
nested_params.description: The key of the tag. Constraints: Tag keys are case-sensitive and accept a maximum of 127 Unicode characters. May not begin with aws:.

nested_params.name: Value
nested_params.description: The value of the tag. Constraints: Tag values are case-sensitive and accept a maximum of 256 Unicode characters.

parameters.name: AvailabilityZone
parameters.description: The Availability Zone or Local Zone for the subnet. Default: Amazon Web Services selects one for you. If you create more than one subnet in your VPC, we do not necessarily select a different zone for each subnet. To create a subnet in a Local Zone, set this value to the Local Zone ID, for example us-west-2-lax-1a. For information about the Regions that support Local Zones, see Available Local Zones. To create a subnet in an Outpost, set this value to the Availability Zone for the Outpost and specify the Outpost ARN.

parameters.name: CidrBlock
parameters.description: The IPv4 network range for the subnet, in CIDR notation. For example, 10.0.0.0/24. We modify the specified CIDR block to its canonical form; for example, if you specify 100.68.0.18/18, we modify it to 100.68.0.0/18. This parameter is not supported for an IPv6 only subnet.

nested_items.name: AvailabilityZoneId
nested_items.description: The AZ ID of the subnet.

nested_items.name: EnableLniAtDeviceIndex
nested_items.description: Indicates the device position for local network interfaces in this subnet. For example, 1 indicates local network interfaces in this subnet are the secondary network interface (eth1).

nested_items.name: MapCustomerOwnedIpOnLaunch
nested_items.description: Indicates whether a network interface created in this subnet (including a network interface created by  RunInstances) receives a customer-owned IPv4 address.

nested_items.name: CustomerOwnedIpv4Pool
nested_items.description: The customer-owned IPv4 address pool associated with the subnet.

nested_items.name: OwnerId
nested_items.description: The ID of the Amazon Web Services account that owns the subnet.

nested_items.name: AssignIpv6AddressOnCreation
nested_items.description: Indicates whether a network interface created in this subnet (including a network interface created by  RunInstances) receives an IPv6 address.

nested_items.name: Ipv6CidrBlockAssociationSet
nested_items.description: Information about the IPv6 CIDR blocks associated with the subnet.

nested_items.name: AssociationId
nested_items.description: The ID of the association.

nested_items.name: Ipv6CidrBlock
nested_items.description: The IPv6 CIDR block.

nested_items.name: Ipv6CidrBlockState
nested_items.description: The state of the CIDR block.

nested_items.name: State
nested_items.description: The state of a CIDR block.

nested_items.name: StatusMessage
nested_items.description: A message about the status of the CIDR block, if applicable.

nested_items.name: Ipv6AddressAttribute
nested_items.description: Public IPv6 addresses are those advertised on the internet from Amazon Web Services. Private IP addresses are not and cannot be advertised on the internet from Amazon Web Services.

nested_items.name: IpSource
nested_items.description: The source that allocated the IP address space. byoip or amazon indicates public IP address space allocated by Amazon or space that you have allocated with Bring your own IP (BYOIP). none indicates private space.

nested_items.name: Tags
nested_items.description: Any tags assigned to the subnet.

nested_items.name: Key
nested_items.description: The key of the tag.

nested_items.name: Value
nested_items.description: The value of the tag.

nested_items.name: SubnetArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the subnet.

nested_items.name: OutpostArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Outpost.

nested_items.name: EnableDns64
nested_items.description: Indicates whether DNS queries made to the Amazon-provided DNS Resolver in this subnet should return synthetic IPv6 addresses for IPv4-only destinations.

nested_items.name: Ipv6Native
nested_items.description: Indicates whether this is an IPv6 only subnet.

nested_items.name: PrivateDnsNameOptionsOnLaunch
nested_items.description: The type of hostnames to assign to instances in the subnet at launch. An instance hostname is based on the IPv4 address or ID of the instance.

nested_items.name: HostnameType
nested_items.description: The type of hostname for EC2 instances. For IPv4 only subnets, an instance DNS name must be based on the instance IPv4 address. For IPv6 only subnets, an instance DNS name must be based on the instance ID. For dual-stack subnets, you can specify whether DNS names use the instance IPv4 address or the instance ID.

nested_items.name: EnableResourceNameDnsARecord
nested_items.description: Indicates whether to respond to DNS queries for instance hostnames with DNS A records.

nested_items.name: EnableResourceNameDnsAAAARecord
nested_items.description: Indicates whether to respond to DNS queries for instance hostname with DNS AAAA records.

nested_items.name: BlockPublicAccessStates
nested_items.description: The state of VPC Block Public Access (BPA).

nested_items.name: InternetGatewayBlockMode
nested_items.description: The mode of VPC BPA.
off: VPC BPA is not enabled and traffic is allowed to and from internet gateways and egress-only internet gateways in this Region.

nested_items.type: except for excluded VPCs and subnets
nested_items.description: block-bidirectional: Block all traffic to and from internet gateways and egress-only internet gateways in this Region (except for excluded VPCs and subnets).

nested_items.type: except for VPCs or subnets which are excluded
nested_items.description: block-ingress: Block all internet traffic to the VPCs in this Region (except for VPCs or subnets which are excluded). Only traffic to and from NAT gateways and egress-only internet gateways is allowed because these gateways only allow outbound connections to be established.

nested_items.name: SubnetId
nested_items.description: The ID of the subnet.

nested_items.name: State
nested_items.description: The current state of the subnet.

nested_items.name: VpcId
nested_items.description: The ID of the VPC the subnet is in.

nested_items.name: CidrBlock
nested_items.description: The IPv4 CIDR block assigned to the subnet.

nested_items.name: AvailableIpAddressCount
nested_items.description: The number of unused private IPv4 addresses in the subnet. The IPv4 addresses for any stopped instances are considered unavailable.

nested_items.name: AvailabilityZone
nested_items.description: The Availability Zone of the subnet.

nested_items.name: DefaultForAz
nested_items.description: Indicates whether this is the default subnet for the Availability Zone.

nested_items.name: MapPublicIpOnLaunch
nested_items.description: Indicates whether instances launched in this subnet receive a public IPv4 address.
